title: Ordinals: A common ground for Ethereum and Bitcoin maximalists? - Kraken Blog
summary: Bitcoin developer Casey Rodarmor has launched a new protocol called Bitcoin Ordinals, which assigns unique identities to individual satoshis on the Bitcoin blockchain. This system allows users to track and transfer these uniquely-identified satoshis like any normal bitcoin unit, but with the added functionality of being entirely on-chain. The Ordinal protocol consists of two main parts: Ordinal theory, which assigns a unique identifier value to each satoshi based on periodic events on the Bitcoin blockchain, and inscription, which associates content with a satoshi using a numbering scheme unique to the Ord software. This innovation has already gained traction, with existing Ethereum-based NFT creators expressing interest in launching their collections on the Bitcoin blockchain. The true impact of Ordinals is still emerging, but it has the potential to combat lost NFTs and open up new revenue streams for NFT creators.

title: What is Optimism (OP): Guide to One of Ethereum’s Layer-Two Scaling Solutions - CryptoPotato
summary: Optimism is an Ethereum scaling solution that aims to improve the mainnet's scalability by taking some of its transactional load. It uses an "Optimistic Rollup" mechanism, which runs the computation off-chain and only submits proof of validity to the chain. The Optimism Collective, a group of companies, communities, and citizens, governs the project, with two houses: the Token House and the Citizens' House. The OP token is the native cryptocurrency of the Optimism ecosystem and is used for governance. The project has distributed 5% of its total supply through an airdrop and plans to allocate 19% more for future airdrops. The team has proposed upgrading the Optimism mainnet to Bedrock, a new generation of decentralized Rollup architecture developed by Optimism Labs.

title: Revolut Launches Crypto Staking for Ethereum, Cardano, Polkadot, and Tezos - Yahoo Finance
summary: Revolut, a UK-based fintech firm, has launched a crypto staking service for Ethereum, Cardano, Polkadot, and Tezos. Users can earn up to 11.65% return in crypto rewards on certain tokens, depending on the token staked. The service is initially available in the UK and select EEA markets. Revolut plans to expand the service to more tokens and countries in the future. The company has also been eyeing a new token launch and assessing the best time to launch its native cryptocurrency, RevCoin.

title: Ethereum Asset Highlight - Smart Contracts - CoinShares
summary: Ethereum's smart contracts enable a wide range of decentralized applications through its programming language, allowing for creativity and a large community of developers. The native asset, ether, has utility in executing programs and transactions on the distributed network of computers.

title: Ethereum gas price spikes 29% in January as user activity grows: Report - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum gas price surged 29% in January, driven by increased user activity. Average gas price rose from 19.2 gwei to 24.82 gwei. Daily active wallets decreased by 10%, while unique active smart contracts increased by 6.74%. Transactions per day decreased by 0.8%, while block size per month increased by 7%. The total block size per month was 17.24 GB, up 7.08% from December. The report suggests that the increase in gas price and block size indicates increased interest in both current blockchain users and smart contract developers.

title: Is Michael Saylor Finally Interested in Ethereum (ETH)? - U.Today
summary: Michael Saylor, a prominent figure in the cryptocurrency market, has expressed skepticism towards Ethereum (ETH) despite being a long-time advocate for Bitcoin (BTC). Saylor believes that ETH has yet to prove its technical and ethical stability and has criticized its centralization and the potential for changes to the protocol by the development team. However, there has been an alleged audio recording of Saylor expressing a desire to sell Bitcoin and invest in Ethereum, raising questions about the authenticity of the recording. Saylor's public statements and tweets suggest that he remains a strong proponent of Bitcoin.

title: Network Activity on Ethereum Is Up, With Uniswap Leading the Charge - Blockworks
summary: Network activity on Ethereum is increasing, with Uniswap leading the charge in terms of gas fees and token burn. Ethereum is experiencing its fourth consecutive week of deflationary issuance, with the number of tokens being burnt greater than the number of tokens being minted. This suggests that the token is limited in supply compared to demand, giving it greater purchasing power. Growing activity on decentralized platforms such as Uniswap could indicate more people turning to DeFi after the collapse of centralized competitors last year. Ethereum gas fees are at their highest levels since July, with Uniswap accounting for the majority of gas guzzling activity. This is seen as a positive sign for the broader crypto ecosystem.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Going to Valhalla, Says Former Ark Invest Analyst - U.Today
summary: Former Ark Invest analyst Chris Burniske predicts Ethereum (ETH) will lead investors to "Valhalla" due to upcoming Shanghai update, which will improve network scalability, security, and performance. Burniske believes the upgrade will cause a breakout of the ETH/Bitcoin pair, leading to new highs. However, some analysts predict unprecedented selling pressure after the update, potentially causing a drop in ETH price. Despite opposing views, Burniske remains confident in his prediction, citing Ethereum's potential to become the leading cryptocurrency and deliver a substantial return on investment.

title: The State of PoS: Delving Into the Risk and Promise of a Staked Future - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
In this article, the authors analyze the current state of decentralization on four popular Proof of Stake (PoS) blockchains: Ethereum, Polkadot, Solana, and Avalanche. They examine various metrics, including the percentage of staked tokens, distribution of token holders, number of validators, geographical distribution of nodes, and diversification on cloud providers.

Key takeaways include:

1. Ethereum has the largest number of validators (508,400) and a relatively balanced distribution of token holders.
2. Polkadot has a smaller number of active validators (297) and a higher concentration of nodes in Europe and North America.
3. Solana has a similar number of validators to Polkadot (1,847) but a less balanced distribution of token holders.
4. Avalanche has a smaller number of validators (1,118) but a more diversified distribution of nodes across cloud providers.
5. Decentralization on these networks is not yet clear, and there is a need for further adjustments to ensure resilience

Revolut has over 25 million global customers and has significantly increased the number of digital assets it supports. The CEO of Revolut expects staking to pick up steam once global financial troubles are dealt with, and the influx of funds into risky assets such as cryptocurrencies is expected once inflation is controlled.

title: Solana Whale Suddenly Moves $184,488,088 As Ethereum Rival Secures Partnership With Brave Browser - The Daily Hodl

This move comes as Solana announces a partnership with Brave browser to integrate Solana DApp support on iOS and Android versions of the browser. The partnership aims to give users browser-based connections to Solana programs optimized for mobile use. The price of Solana (SOL) is up nearly 200% from its lows early last month, currently trading for $23.35, while Brave's native token (BAT) is up 52% in the last month, currently worth 0.29.

title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: Is There A Long-term Case For Crypto? - CoinGape
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum, the two largest cryptocurrencies, are facing a long-term investment decision. Bitcoin's price is currently at $22,953, with a potential to reach $25,000 in the coming months. Ethereum's price is steady at $1,633, with a potential to reach $1,750. Both cryptocurrencies have strong growth potential, but are also volatile. Investing in cryptocurrencies for the long term requires careful consideration of factors such as technology, adoption, regulation, market demand, and detailed research.

title: MATIC Spikes As Ethereum Whales Show Interest, Buying Over 2 Million Tokens - NewsBTC
summary: MATIC, a lesser-known altcoin, has seen a significant spike in price after two large Ethereum whales purchased over 2 million tokens, worth $2.6 billion. This purchase has had a notable impact on MATIC's price, causing it to surge by 4% in the past 24 hours and record a profit of nearly 20% in the past week. MATIC has moved upward before the whales' intervention, especially since the beginning of the year, and has climbed from $0.75 to $1.28 in price. The Polygon token ranks tenth in market capitalization, with a market cap of $11.5 billion, higher than Solana but below Dogecoin. Other altcoins, such as Shiba Inu, have also seen significant gains, with whales holding over $100 million in MATIC and less than 700 million SHIB tokens. However, it is important to note that investing in cryptocurrencies carries risks and should be conducted with caution.

title: Chiliz Launches Native Blockchain in Shift Away From 'Just Being a Token': CEO - Decrypt
summary: Chiliz, the crypto startup behind fan token platform Socios, has launched its new layer-1 blockchain, Chiliz Chain 2.0, which is a fork of the BNB Chain operating on a proof-of-stake authority (PoSA) consensus mechanism. The launch marks the project's fifth anniversary and comes with a new logo rebrand. The new chain will feature a system of 11 active validators and will allow sports and entertainment brands, as well as developers, to mint NFTs, build DeFi applications, or play-to-earn games. The Chiliz native token, CHZ, will power the entire ecosystem and be used to pay gas fees and receive rewards for securing the network. The company will also organize a series of global hackathons for developers to boost adoption of the blockchain.

title: Chiliz (CHZ) Debuts EVM-Compatible L1 Blockchain - Ethereum World News
summary: Chiliz (CHZ) debuted its own layer 1 decentralized network, compatible with Ethereum's Virtual Machine, allowing for on-chain gaming and NFTs tied to world sports franchises. title: How to Setup RPC on Metamask – Easy Guide - CryptoTicker.io - Bitcoin Price, Ethereum Price & Crypto News
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Metamask is a popular decentralized wallet that allows users to connect to decentralized apps (DApps) and access various blockchain networks. However, the default node provided by Metamask can sometimes become overcrowded and slow, leading to slower transaction processing and irregular block data. To improve the user experience, users can add a custom RPC to their Metamask, which detaches them from the default node and plugs them into a less-busy node. This article provides step-by-step instructions on how to set up a custom RPC on Metamask, including choosing a network, copying important details from the network's official documentation, and saving the new network in Metamask.

title: Ethereum upgrade moving on track to implement super important update for ETH ecosystem - Crypto News Flash
summary: Ethereum's Zhejiang testnet successfully processed staked ETH withdrawals, moving the ecosystem closer to its historic transition to a fully-featured proof-of-stake network. The upgrade is the first of three dress rehearsals before the Shanghai upgrade in March. Validators can now withdraw 16 million staked ETH, and the update aims to encourage more staking and potentially reduce the price of ETH due to pressure from stakers. The article provides information for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum rival digital pound will have saving limit to avoid “Hoarding Britcoin” - Crypto News Flash
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The UK is working on introducing a digital pound, which could be issued by the Central Bank of England. The digital pound aims to provide a more stable alternative to Bitcoin and Ethereum, but there are concerns that consumers may hoard or shift their wealth instantly between accounts due to the frictionless nature of digital money. To address this, authorities are considering limits on individuals' holdings of the digital pound. The digital pound would not bear any interest and would be risk-free, equivalent in value to physical pounds. A consultation on the implementation of the digital pound will take place in the next four months, with decisions not expected until 2025.
